item.title: Pax Autocratica enters Early Access February 2nd
item.content:encoded:
Multiverse has revealed that its mashup colony sim and roguelite first person shooter Pax Autocratica will launch into early access on February 2nd. A new trailer has been released to confirm the news of the release, showing elements of the colony building and the first person shooter action. You can get a glimpse of Pax Autocratica below.

In Pax Autocratica, you are Leader of Auroria and it is your role to build a fully totalitarian state in your vision. It can be a place of utter ruthlessness to one or benevolence. You need to find a balance to keep your citizens Fear, Happiness, Hunger, and Loyalty in check so they will follow you. The civilisation starts as a small cluster of shelters but through resource gathering, management of your citizens, and issuing decrees you can build a bustling autocratic state.

You might be wondering where the first person shooting comes into all of this. Well, you are not the only civisilation around. There are other regimes in the Tyris System and each one presents a danger. The FPS side will see you face off against these enemies of the state through small skirmishes to big battles that will involve mechs, tanks, and infantry. There will be hundreds of different of different buffs that will shape how these expeditions will play out. The studio has also confirmed AI has been used to generate some portraits and icons in Pax Autocratica, but is looking to remove all of them before the game is launched and replaced with the work of the game’s artists.

Multiverse made a statement about donations to the Norwegian Refugee Council saying, “1% of all net revenue from Pax Autocratica will be donated to support people forced too flee violence in conflict areas through the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC), a politically neutral humanitarian organization assisting civilians affected by war, displacement, and oppression.”

Pax Autocratica has so far only been confirmed for PC.

Source: Steam

item.title: Football Manager 26 update 26.1.1 improves match report screen
item.content:encoded:
Sports Interactive has released update 26.1.1 today and one of the biggest changes that has come part of this is a more detailed halt time and full time match report screen. Prior to the update, this screen would give very basic information showing the score, goalscorers, one team’s player ratings and match stats. The new screen show shows both team’s player ratings, all the scores from around the league, and a better live league view. There are also a lot more match stats in the stats section. You can see the new screen below.

The Football Manager update 26.1.1 has also addressed different logic issues, with these relating to player and staff contract renewals, the assistant manager’s creation of mentoring groups, and expanding the active recruitment focuses to cover all active competitions in the game. You can check out the changelog below.

Technical Issues

  • Various Crash and Stability fixes.
  • Fixed a softlock when selecting the Best of the Rest club expectation, then removing it when accepted.
  • In-game items (Tactics, set pieces, shortlists, etc) will now show the correct time when saved.
  • Refined shadows in overcast matches.
  • Fixed a rare issue where certain saves couldn’t be loaded after switching from the Steam Public Beta Track in the last update.
  • Fixed a rare issue of crowd noise audio continuing after the match has been completed.
  • Fixed an online issue where the processing timer would appear within matches.

User Interface (UI)

  • Improved half time and post-match report screen (shown above).
  • Improved past-match report screen.
  • Fixed an issue with the NXGN & Top Player in the World Award news items not displaying all the candidates.
  • Fixed an issue where the UI would become unresponsive after selecting the same Shout option twice in a row.
  • Weather description no longer duplicates within Team News.
  • Players who have recently left the team no longer display as an option for Set Piece Takers.
  • State saving for Selected Position is now enabled within the Squad Planner.
  • Added multiple Columns to Player Search > Scout > Transfer table view.
  • Added ‘Choose Visuals’ dropdown within Player Report > Performance Data.
  • Added ability to see Staff Attributes on the Club Staff Coaching / Recruitment / Medical / All screen.
  • Offers received on the Deadline Day will now be a Must-respond item.
  • Added a tooltip about Form within Opposition Report.
  • Fixed issues surrounding the +/- buttons disappearing.
  • Viewing past seasons results within the Stages card now functions correctly.
  • The Ability and Potential columns now populate correctly within the Squad General Info view for AI teams.
  • Subbed off players will no longer appear in the right-click drop-down menu within Match Tactics.
  • Fixed an issue where user are unable to make substitutions from the squad bar in matches
  • Own goals now display as intended within Match pop-up captions.
  • Clicking “expand” on the Live Table now functions correctly.
  • The correct lineup will now display for Opposition Instructions during a match.
  • Fixed an issue where the captain indicator wasn’t appearing within UEFA Men’s Champions League and Conference League graphics.
  • The players shown on the Youth Candidates portal message are now sorted by their rating category.
  • B Team average age now displays correctly within the Portal message.
  • Improvements made to offering out players via TransferRoom Out tool.
  • User Transfer Budget now updates instantly when selling Clauses.
  • User Player’s Transfer Status now updates instantly when they are removed from transfer/loan list.
  • Squad screen now displays the wage that a loan player currently earns at the club the player is at, not the wage of the player at the parent club.
  • Fixed an issue where player contract demands were not displayed correctly when user ‘Asks Agent About Market Interest’ for a Free Agent.
  • The ‘i’ icon now correctly appears within the contracts expiring portal message.
  • The Contract Negotiation button will no longer be active if the player has signed a pre-contract agreement already.
  • Full details of a Future Fee Loan Deal now display correctly within Clauses.
  • Fixed an issue where the new season increase of ticket prices would display as 0%, regardless of actual figure.
  • Sorting by Position now functions correctly on the Individual Training screen.
  • The Coaching Conditions filter now functions correctly within Player Database.
  • The sort by position column now functions correctly within League > Player Stats.
  • Scout filter results will no longer show players who don’t meet the correct ability/potential criteria.
  • Confirming the Suggested XI from the Portal message now functions correctly.
  • Fixed an issue where the Continue button wouldn’t display on the pre-match Team Talk screen.
  • Fixed an issue where the Graphic Quality wouldn’t open its dropdown menu within Preferences.
  • Fixed an issue where the ‘Send re-scouted player reports to Messages’ option within Shortlist wouldn’t work.
  • Fixed an issue where changing the tab and any responsibilities while in ‘Delegation’ would reset the user to the ‘Overview’ tab in Staff Responsibilities.

Gameplay

  • Improvements to player logic for wanting a new contract.
  • Improved staff contract renewal logic.
  • Improved logic/messaging behind older players asking for new contracts.
  • Improved logic to backup players demanding play time to get a national team call up.
  • Lowered the number of players at ‘Elite Clubs’ wanting the Domestic Trophy Promise.
  • Users can now create Recruitment Focus for all active competitions in the save game.
  • Resolved an issue where AI clubs would offer illogical playing time in their Loan Back offer.
  • Resolved an issue where loan players were recalled to be sold at illogical times of the season.
  • Fixed a rare issue where AI club would make future fee loan bid for player who has just joined the users club.
  • Loan players can no longer get recalled if the loan club has trigged the buy clause.
  • Fixed an issue where the Qualifying for UEFA Champions League conditional future fee would be triggered by qualifying for any European Competition.
  • Fixed an issue where a player would want to be appointed as both captain and vice-captain in pre-contract promises at the same time.
  • Tweaks made to ensure AI clubs don’t make repeated loan offers for the same player.
  • Functionality for the ‘Propose Loan Extension’ option now working as intended.
  • Asking the assistant to create Mentoring Groups now works as intended.
  • Added a “Makeshift” player positional rating icon.

In Game Editor

  • Player/Non-Player header bar now updates instantly after transferring via the IGE.
  • Fixed an issue where user was unable to edit Corporate Facilities rating.
  • The “+” button next to the fee amounts now functions correctly.
  • Dropdowns are now converted to tabs.
  • Stopped IGE icon being disabled incorrectly on secondary Squad, Recruitment, and Match Day tabs if already selected or navigated to via tab.

Source: FM26 Update (26.1.1) Out Now – FM26 Updates – Sports Interactive Community

item.title: Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven launches January 22nd
item.content:encoded:
Devolver Digital has confirmed that Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven, the new DLC content for the sheep based strategy game, will be launching on January 22nd. As part of the announcement, a new trailer has been released with a majority showing an animation that seems to set up events, while the latter part gives a look at some of the gameplay in small snippets.

In Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven players are tasked with finding the souls of dead Lambs for Yngya, the God of Winter. With each soul, Yngya gets stronger and the challenges for the Cult can get more difficult. As well as appeasing Yngya, you need to survive the cold winter that has descended on the land. You will need to keep cult members fed and warm so they do not freeze, there are new traits and quests to discover, and you will be able to expand your base. There are also new structures such as the Exorcism Altar, and you can expand the base with new shops and a ranch.

Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven will also have two new dungeons, and those are Ewefall and The Rot. Ewefall is the exterior snowy part of the mountain which is the domain of Marchosias, the leader of the Free Pack. The Free Pack are not welcoming to the Gods and will not let them have the mountain, so they have to be defeated. The Rot is the interior of the mountain where anything living inside is corrupted. In The Rot, some of the quests include helping a dragon hatch her eggs and making a garden bloom.

Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven will be available for PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series XS, Xbox One, and Switch.

Source: Steam

item.title: Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 Winter update adds custom difficulty
item.content:encoded:
The Chinese Room and Paradox Interactive have released the Winter Update for Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2, with one of the main features being custom difficulty. With this, players can change things like starting health, the amount of damage Phyre can inflict, and allows passive ability recharging. However, this is not a setting that is accessible for new players but those who have the An Elder Unchained achievement or trophy. Custom difficulty cannot be changed after a playthrough has started either.

In addition to the custom difficulty option, Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 is getting some suitably festive and Christmassy items including a Santa hat and beard, with The Chinese Room also confirming beards will be added in a later update. An FOV Slider and a Motion Blur Toggle have also been added, and you can read the full patch notes below.

Cosmetics Update

  • 8 hairs
  • 8 faces
  • 4 Accessories (rename of piercings)
  • 8 eyes.

Custom Difficulty

  • Player customization of various aspects of the game has been added to enable players to have a bespoke experience that suits their player preferences.

    • Reactive Crosshair
    • Character Reaction UI
    • Elixir Capacity
    • Phyre Starting Health
    • Phyre’s Damage
    • Masquerade Sensitivity
    • Ability Recharging
    • Targeting Time Dilation
    • Enemy Damage
    • Enemy Awareness
    • Quests (playing as single or both protagonists)
    • Iron Vamp

Accessibility Improvements

Improvements to the accessibility options within the game.

    • Field of View
    • Combat FOV boost
    • Lensing
    • Motion Blur
    • Gamepad Aim Assist – Auto Tracking
    • Gamepad Aim Assist – Aim Slowdown

Gameplay Improvements

  • Padlocks will no longer stay locked if enemies have fallen through the floor or walls.
  • Padlocks will state the number of enemies nearby and have been balanced to detect enemies over a smaller distance.
  • Fixed several abilities incorrectly cancelling ongoing abilities, such as split second and enter oblivion.
  • Fixed Taunt working incorrectly on unaware opponents.
  • Fixed an issue with Enemies not hunting the player after losing track of them.
    • IAO are now more effective at warning allies of danger.
  • Adjusted the player’s climbing behaviour to make it easier to climb onto thin platforms without falling off.
  • Fixed an issue where the achievement “Catch!” would not be triggered.
  • Fixed an issue where enemies staggered by an attack were still able to evade.
  • Fixed certain enemies being able to use recall while incapacitated by player abilities.
  • Fixed some player attacks not buffering inputs for a follow-up attack.
  • You are no longer able to use blurred momentum to “dodge” your own boiling blood.
  • Players can no longer repeatedly complete the “Executive Delivery” side quest to farm unlimited ability points.
  • The interruptible casting period of blood curse has been made resistant to light damage.

Bug fixes

  • Various optimisations to improve performance and memory usage.
  • Fixes to various lines overlapping.
  • The DLC Jukebox briefly disappeared once after interacting with it during the quest “In Chains of Lead and Gold”.
  • For some quests after Hub Break1 the ‘Auto Repair Shop’ is inaccessible during hub traversal.
  • The Unbirthed fails to spawn if the player navigates along the edges of the room during the Unbirthed intro sequence in the ‘As Above, So Below’ quest.
  • Progression blocker occurs when player recalls to ward location after placing it before pulling wooden planks in ‘As Above, So Below’ quest.
  • Player can teleport to previous quest stage location by using Recall ability after killing the Gardener, blocking progression.
  • Incorrect quest name displayed on the map after completing “The Coursing of the Rats” quest.
  • If you complete Onda’s mission (or Mrs Thorn where it ends outside) then die in any way, you can exploit the experience system to give you 1000 exp every time you reload after death.
  • Player can kill Izzy again and again to farm ability points.
  • NPCs are not holding the items they are meant to be using e.g. cigarettes, phones etc.
  • Melancholic NPCs react incorrectly to the aggressive dialog “I can destroy you” during Blood Resonance conversations.
  • Steamdeck – NPC heart effects appears to be misaligned while viewed in Heightened Senses during open-world gameplay.
  • Back face culling is visible for the white fur of “The General” outfit during conversation with Safia and Lou in Tome Alone quest.

Achievement

  • Achievement Unoriginal Sin does not unlock after feeding on five Sanguine NPCs while wearing Priest outfit as Lasombra “A Full-Blooded Elder” achievement fails to unlock despite unlocking 77/78 achievements.
  • “What Sup?” achievement count does not update after feeding on Choleric NPC.
  • ‘Breach Contained’ achievement fails to unlock after recovering from a Masquerade breach on Casual difficulty.
  • The crosshair remains visible during the Safia boss fight intro cutscene in the ‘The Streets Incarnadine’ quest.

Save and Load

  • Death Letter conversation auto-skips with no dialogue prompts after autosave reload in Fabien’s office.
  • Marla’s conversation auto-skips with no dialogue prompts after autosave reload in 1920s Makom Bar sequence.
  • Spirit Touch conversation with Filing Cabinet fails to display dialogue prompt when reloading from autosave.
  • Fabien is unable to interact with Mr.Lemon upon checkpoint reload after enquiring about Memory loss.

Source: Steam
